ARTICLE A. RESTAURANTS AND MOBILE FOOD DISPENSING SERVICES
SECTION:
5-1A-1: Definitions
5-1A-2: License And Compliance Required
5-1A-3: Applications For Licenses
5-1A-4: License Fees And Renewals
5-1A-5: Ice Cream Truck Restrictions
5-1A-6: Food And Drink Regulations
5-1A-7: Employees
5-1A-8: Premises Restrictions
5-1A-9: Toilet Facilities
5-1A-10: Water Supply
5-1A-11: Utensils And Equipment
5-1A-12: Litter, Garbage And Waste
5-1A-13: Alcoholic Beverages, Persons Under Influence Prohibited
5-1A-14: Inspections
5-1A-15: Suspension Or Revocation Of License
5-1A-16: Effect On Other Provisions
5-1A-17: Penalties
5-1A-1: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this article, the following words and terms shall have the meanings
ascribed to them in this section:
ICE CREAM TRUCK: Every motor vehicle in which ice cream, popsicles, ice
sherbets or frozen desserts of any kind are carried for purposes of retail sale
on the city streets.
MOBILE FOOD DISPENSING SERVICE: Any vehicle or device designed or used for the
purpose of preparing or serving food or drink to the public for consumption
including, but not limited to, vehicles, ice cream trucks, ice cream vendors or
food carts.
OPERATOR: Every person, firm, corporation or entity who owns, leases, contracts
or in any other fashion permits a person to operate any mobile food dispensing
service for the purpose of "vending" as defined in this section.
PERSON: Every driver of any "mobile food dispensing service" as defined in this
section.
RESTAURANT: Any place where food or drink is prepared or served to the public
for consumption on the premises or as carryout including any mobile food
dispensing service, including, but not limited to, vehicles or food carts.
VEND OR VENDING: Offering food, drink, ice cream, popsicles, ice sherbets or
frozen desserts for sale from a mobile food dispensing service. (Ord. 2003-O-
55, 9-2-2003)
5-1A-2: LICENSE AND COMPLIANCE REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful to operate a restaurant or mobile food dispensing service
in the city without first having obtained a license therefor, or without full
compliance with the provisions of this article. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-2003)
5-1A-3: APPLICATIONS FOR LICENSES:
Applications for licenses shall be made in writing to the office of the city
clerk on forms promulgated by said office and shall comply with the general
provisions of this article.
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â Restaurant License: All applications for a license to conduct a
restaurant shall be referred to the building official, who shall make or cause
to be made an investigation of the premises/vehicle to be used, and report his
findings thereon, recommending or advising against the issuance of the license.
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â Mobile Food Dispensing Service License:
Â Â Â Â Â Â 1.Â Â Â All applications for any mobile food dispensing service license
which is sought and/or granted shall specify the area and/or location which the
mobile food dispensing service will operate. Further, the applicant shall
specify the number of such vehicles to be located in said location or area, and
shall not exceed the number so permitted. Any application for a mobile food
dispensing service license shall require the consent of the property owner if
located on private property, or the consent of the city if upon public property
or a dedicated way or public area.
Â Â Â Â Â Â 2.Â Â Â Any application for a mobile food dispensing service license
requiring a vehicle shall be accompanied by proof of liability insurance in a
minimum sum of one million dollars ($1,000,000.00) (or such other amounts and
requirements as may be acceptable to the mayor in his sole discretion) and
issued by companies licensed to do business in the state of Illinois. Such
insurance certificate shall contain an agreement signed by the insurance
company that, prior to modification, cancellation or termination of the subject
policy, written notice shall be sent to the city by said insurance company.
Â Â Â Â Â Â 3.Â Â Â Any application for a mobile food dispensing service license shall
be accompanied by a list of the drivers who may service the area, their
drivers' license numbers, addresses and telephone numbers. Further, such
information shall disclose whether the drivers possess valid drivers' licenses,
the state of issuance of the drivers' licenses, the expiration dates and
whether the licenses are in good standing.
Â Â Â Â Â Â 4.Â Â Â Every owner, operator, and driver for a mobile food dispensing
service shall be of good and wholesome character. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-2003)
Â Â Â Â Â Â 5.Â Â Â Every mobile food dispensing service shall be inspected by the
county health department at least once a year. A copy of the certificate of
compliance issued by the county shall be provided with the application.
Â Â Â Â Â Â 6.Â Â Â Due to safety, traffic and other factors which may impact on the
public health, safety and welfare, the issuance of any license for a mobile
food dispensing service shall be first referred to the mayor, and shall not be
issued unless the mayor determines that the license does not present a
significant danger to the public health, safety or welfare. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-
2-2003; amd. 2009 Code)
5-1A-4: LICENSE FEES AND RENEWALS:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â Restaurants: The annual fee for a restaurant license shall be as
provided in section
3-2A-1 of this code and must be renewed on or before September 1 of each year
following the date of issuance thereof. No license fee shall be collected from
any establishment previously issued a retail liquor license. There shall be no
prorations in the restaurant license fee.
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â Mobile Food Dispensing Services: The annual fee for a mobile food
dispensing service license shall be as provided in section
3-2A-1 of this code and must be renewed on or before September 1 of each year
following the date of issuance thereof. There shall be no prorations in the
mobile food dispensing service license fee. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-2003; amd.
2009 Code)
Â Â Â C.Â Â Â Inspection Fee For License Renewals: An annual inspection fee as
provided in section
3-2A-1 of this code shall be paid at the time of renewal application. (Ord.
2007-O-29, 9-4-2007; amd. 2009 Code)
5-1A-5: ICE CREAM TRUCK RESTRICTIONS:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â A person shall vend only when the ice cream truck is lawfully stopped.
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â A person shall vend only from the side of the truck away from moving
traffic and as near as possible to the curb or side of the street.
Â Â Â C.Â Â Â A person shall not vend to a person standing in the roadway.
Â Â Â D.Â Â Â A person shall not stop on the left side of a one-way street to vend.
Â Â Â E.Â Â Â The driver of an ice cream truck shall not back the same to make or
attempt a sale.
Â Â Â F.Â Â Â The operator of an ice cream truck may only play music, chimes or
amplified sounds while vending and only between the hours of twelve o'clock
(12:00) noon and eight o'clock (8:00) P.M.
Â Â Â G.Â Â Â The operator of an ice cream truck may drive through the streets of the
city for purposes of vending and only between the hours of twelve o'clock (12:
00) noon and eight o'clock (8:00) P.M. Thereafter, vending may occur only from
a single parked location through ten o'clock (10:00) P.M. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-
2003)
5-1A-6: FOOD AND DRINK REGULATIONS:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â Wholesomeness Of Food And Drink:
Â Â Â Â Â Â 1.Â Â Â No person, firm or corporation shall offer for sale or keep for the
purpose of selling or offering for sale any food of any kind intended for human
consumption which is spoiled or tainted or is unwholesome and unfit for human
consumption for any reason.
Â Â Â Â Â Â 2.Â Â Â All food and drink shall be clean, wholesome, free from spoilage,
and so prepared as to be safe for human consumption.
Â Â Â Â Â Â 3.Â Â Â All milk, fluid milk products, ice cream and other frozen desserts
served shall be from approved sources. Milk and fluid milk products shall be
served in the individual containers in which they were received from the
distributor or from a bulk container equipped with an approved dispensing
device; provided, that this requirement shall not apply to cream which may be
served from the original bottle or from a dispenser approved for such service.
Â Â Â Â Â Â 4.Â Â Â All oysters, clams and mussels shall be from approved sources, and
if shucked, shall be kept until used in the containers in which they were
placed at the shucking plant.
Â Â Â Â Â Â 5.Â Â Â Samples of food, drink and other substances may be taken and
examined by the building official as often as may be necessary for the
detection of unwholesomeness or adulteration. The building official may condemn
and forbid the sale of, or cause to be removed or destroyed, any food or drink
which is unwholesome or adulterated.
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â Refrigeration: All readily perishable food and drink shall be kept at
or below thirty five degrees Fahrenheit (35Â°F) except when being prepared or
served. Wastewater from refrigeration equipment shall be properly disposed of.
Â Â Â C.Â Â Â Storage, Display And Serving Of Food And Drink:
Â Â Â Â Â Â 1.Â Â Â All food and drink shall be so stored, displayed and served as to be
protected from dust, insects, vermin, depredation and pollution by rodents,
unnecessary handling, droplet infection, overhead leakage and other
contamination. All means necessary for the elimination of insects, flies,
roaches and rodents shall be used.
Â Â Â Â Â Â 2.Â Â Â No animals or fowl shall be kept or allowed in any room in which
food or drink is prepared or stored. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-2003)
5-1A-7: EMPLOYEES:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â Health And Sanitation:
Â Â Â Â Â Â 1.Â Â Â All persons engaged in handling or coming in contact with food
intended for sale for human consumption shall keep themselves clean, both as to
their person and clothing.
Â Â Â Â Â Â 2.Â Â Â It shall be unlawful for any person who is afflicted with or is a
carrier of any infectious or contagious disease to handle or be engaged in the
care or preparation of any food, and it shall be unlawful to permit any such
person to be employed in or about any premises where food is stored, prepared
or sold, or to deliver such food. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-2003)
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â Lockers And Dressing Rooms: Adequate lockers or dressing rooms shall be
provided for employees' clothing and shall be kept clean. Soiled linens, coats
and aprons shall be kept in containers provided for this purpose. (Ord. 2003-O-
55, 9-2-2003; amd. 2009 Code)
5-1A-8: PREMISES RESTRICTIONS:
None of the operations connected with a restaurant shall be conducted in any
room used as living or sleeping quarters. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-2003)
5-1A-9: TOILET FACILITIES:
Every restaurant (other than a mobile food dispensing service) shall be
provided with adequate and conveniently located toilet facilities for its
patrons and employees, which facilities shall conform to the ordinances of the
city. Toilet rooms shall be kept in a clean condition, and in good repair, and
well lighted and ventilated. Hand washing signs shall be posted in each toilet
room used by employees. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-2003; amd. 2009 Code)
5-1A-10: WATER SUPPLY:
Running water under pressure shall be easily accessible to all rooms in which
food is prepared or utensils are washed, and the water supply shall be adequate
and of a safe, sanitary quality. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-2003)
5-1A-11: UTENSILS AND EQUIPMENT:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â Construction And Materials: All multiuse utensils and all show and
display cases or windows, counters, shelves, tables, refrigeration equipment,
sinks and other equipment or utensils used in connection with the operation of
a restaurant shall be constructed as to be easily cleaned and shall be kept in
good repair. Utensils containing or plated with cadmium or lead shall not be
used; provided, that solder containing lead may be used for joining.
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â Cleaning And Bactericidal Treatment:
Â Â Â Â Â Â 1.Â Â Â All equipment, including display cases or windows, counters,
shelves, tables, refrigerators, stoves, hoods and sinks, shall be kept clean
and free from dust, dirt, insects and other contaminating material. All cloths
used by waiters, chefs and other employees shall be clean. Single service
containers shall be used only once.
Â Â Â Â Â Â 2.Â Â Â All multiuse eating and drinking utensils shall be thoroughly
cleaned and effectively subjected to an approved bactericidal process after
each use. All multiuse utensils used in the preparation or serving of food and
drink shall be thoroughly cleaned and effectively subjected to an approved
process immediately following the day's operation. Drying cloths, if used,
shall be kept clean and shall be used for no other purpose.
Â Â Â Â Â Â 3.Â Â Â No article, polish or other substance containing a cyanide
preparation or other poisonous material shall be used for the cleaning or
polishing of utensils.
Â Â Â C.Â Â Â Storage And Handling: After bactericidal treatment, utensils shall be
stored in a clean, dry place protected from insects, dust and other
contamination, and shall be handled in such a manner as to prevent
contamination as far as practicable. Single service utensils shall be purchased
only in containers, shall be stored therein in a clean, dry place until used,
and shall be handled in a sanitary manner. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-2003)
5-1A-12: LITTER, GARBAGE AND WASTE:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â Accumulation Prohibited: The premises of all restaurants shall be kept
clean and free of litter or garbage.
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â Disposal Of Waste: All waste shall be properly disposed of, and all
garbage and trash shall be kept in regulation, watertight, properly covered
containers for holding without leakage. All garbage containers shall be closed
with a tightfitting cover. All garbage and other waste material shall be
removed from the premises daily and shall not be allowed to become a nuisance.
(Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-2003)
Â Â Â C.Â Â Â Grease Traps: Each restaurant (other than a mobile food dispensing
service) shall be provided with a grease trap installed in strict compliance
with the plumbing ordinances of the city. The owner shall cause the grease trap
to be inspected not less than once a year to ensure that the trap is
functioning as required. The owner shall provide proof of such inspection at
the time of renewal application. (Ord. 2007-O-29, 9-4-2007)
5-1A-13: ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES, PERSONS UNDER INFLUENCE PROHIBITED:
No licensee hereunder shall permit any person or persons to be upon the
premises who are under the influence of intoxicating liquor. Except to the
extent authorized by a city liquor license as provided under this code, no
licensee hereunder shall offer for sale, sell, dispense or permit any
intoxicating liquor in such place of business; nor shall any licensee hereunder
permit any intoxicating liquor to be consumed upon the business premises. (Ord.
2003-O-55, 9-2-2003; amd. 2009 Code)
5-1A-14: INSPECTIONS:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â At least every six (6) months, the building official or his designee
(which may be the Lake County health department) may inspect every premises to
which a license has been issued by the city. Said inspection is to examine all
premises wherein restaurants are conducted for the purposes of ascertaining
whether this article and all other ordinances of the city and the laws of the
state relative to the keeping of restaurants are being complied with at such
place, and it shall be their duty to cause all such ordinances and laws to be
strictly enforced. In case the building official discovers the violation of any
item of sanitation, or otherwise, he shall make a second inspection after the
lapse of such time as he deems necessary for the defect to be remedied, and the
second inspection shall be used in determining compliance with the requirements
of this article or any other ordinance. Any violation of the same requirement
of this article or such second inspection shall call for immediate revocation
of the license. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-2003)
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â One copy of the inspection report shall be posted by the building
official upon an inside wall of the restaurant, and said inspection report
shall not be defaced or removed by any person except the building official.
Another copy of the inspection report shall be filed with the records of the
county health department. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-2003; amd. 2009 Code)
Â Â Â C.Â Â Â The person operating the restaurant shall, upon request of the building
official, permit access to all parts of the establishment and shall permit
copying any or all records of foods purchased. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-2003)
5-1A-15: SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
Any restaurant license may be suspended by the mayor for any violation of this
article and revoked by the mayor, with the advice and consent of the city
council, for violation of the provisions herein, or for any violation of any
other ordinance, code, statute, or applicable governmental regulation or
provision relating to the conduct of the business, the condition of the
premises/vehicle, the articles sold, or to the license required. (Ord. 2003-O-
55, 9-2-2003)
5-1A-16: EFFECT ON OTHER PROVISIONS:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â Nothing contained in this article shall be construed to repeal any
other ordinances except as hereinafter provided, and it is expressly intended
that all building, health, licensing and other ordinances of the city, as
applicable, shall apply to restaurants and restaurant premises.
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â Other than as set forth in this chapter, all ordinances, parts of
ordinances, regulations of the city, and administrative provisions of the city
in conflict herewith are hereby repealed. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-2003)
5-1A-17: PENALTIES:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â Any person, partnership, firm, entity or corporation in violation of
any provision of this article shall be fined as provided in section
1-4-1 of this code. (2009 Code)
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â The conviction or punishment of any person, partnership, firm, entity
or corporation for violation of the provisions of this article shall not
release such person from paying any fee due and unpaid at the time of such
conviction, nor shall payment of any fee prevent prosecution for violation of
any of the provisions of this article.
Â Â Â C.Â Â Â The amount of any fee due hereunder shall be deemed a debt to the city.
An action may be commenced in the name of the city in any court of competent
jurisdiction for the amount of any delinquent fee. All unpaid fees shall be
deemed delinquent after they are due and payable.
Â Â Â D.Â Â Â All remedies shall be cumulative, and the use of one or more remedies
by the city shall not bar the use of any other remedy. (Ord. 2003-O-55, 9-2-
2003)
ARTICLE B. SIDEWALK CAFES
SECTION:
5-1B-1: Definition
5-1B-2: Compliance Required
5-1B-3: License Required
5-1B-4: Application For License; Fee
5-1B-5: Insurance And Indemnity
5-1B-6: License Restrictions
5-1B-7: Term Of License; Renewals
5-1B-8: Free And Unobstructed Passage Required
5-1B-9: Sidewalk Maintenance Required
5-1B-10: Attendant Required
5-1B-11: Food And Drink Control
5-1B-12: Noise Control
5-1B-13: Expansion Areas
5-1B-14: Cancellation Or Revocation Of License
5-1B-15: Penalties
5-1B-1: DEFINITION:
Use of any part of any public sidewalk within the city by any business to
provide or serve either any food or any beverage, or both, or as a seating or
waiting area shall constitute operation of a "sidewalk cafe". (Ord. 2003-O-44,
7-1-2003)
5-1B-2: COMPLIANCE REQUIRED:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â Any use of any part of any public sidewalk or way within the city by a
sidewalk cafe shall be done only in accordance with the provisions of this
article. Any use of any part of any public sidewalk within the city contrary to
or in violation of this article shall be unlawful.
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â Any person, partnership, firm, corporation, or entity making
application for a sidewalk cafe license shall be deemed to have consented to
the provisions of this article. (Ord. 2003-O-44, 7-1-2003)
5-1B-3: LICENSE REQUIRED:
No person shall operate any sidewalk cafe within the city unless and until a
license for the same has first been issued. (Ord. 2003-O-44, 7-1-2003)
5-1B-4: APPLICATION FOR LICENSE; FEE:
Application for a license for operation of a sidewalk cafe shall be filed with
the city clerk on a form provided by or in such a format as specified by the
city clerk. Each person filing a request for a license to operate a sidewalk
cafe shall pay to the city clerk, at the time of filing the request, a fee as
provided in section
3-2A-1 of this code. (Ord. 2003-O-44, 7-1-2003; amd. 2009 Code)
5-1B-5: INSURANCE AND INDEMNITY:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â Insurance: Any person issued a license to operate a sidewalk cafe
within the city shall, prior to commencing any operation as a sidewalk cafe,
name the city as an additional insured on a policy of liability insurance which
the city deems sufficient both as to insurance carrier and liability amounts.
Such liability shall include, but not be limited to, dramshop coverage (if any
alcoholic beverage is to be served by the applicant requesting the sidewalk
cafe license, whether such service is inside or outside). If the insurance
coverage lapses, or the city determines that the coverage is not sufficient,
the city may revoke the license. Such license shall not be considered for
reinstatement until sufficient insurance coverage is provided.
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â Indemnity: Any person issued a license to operate a sidewalk cafe does
thereby agree to fully indemnify and hold the city harmless from any claim
whatsoever arising as a result of or due to any use of the public sidewalk or
way, or any part thereof, as a result of or in accordance with the sidewalk
cafe license. Such indemnification and hold harmless shall include any and all
costs and/or attorney fees incurred by the city in defense of any claim. (Ord.
2003-O-44, 7-1-2003)
5-1B-6: LICENSE RESTRICTIONS:
A sidewalk cafe license shall be issued only to a properly licensed restaurant
which does not serve alcoholic beverages or to a properly licensed restaurant
holding a class 2, 2A, 2W or 5 liquor license. (Ord. 2006-O-27, 8-15-2006)
5-1B-7: TERM OF LICENSE; RENEWALS:
Any license issued for operation of a sidewalk cafe shall expire on the next
following June 30. Application to operate a sidewalk cafe for the next
succeeding year shall be due prior to July 1 of each year, and no continuing
operation of a sidewalk cafe shall be permitted unless and until a new license
for the next year is issued. (Ord. 2003-O-44, 7-1-2003)
5-1B-8: FREE AND UNOBSTRUCTED PASSAGE REQUIRED:
The license to operate a sidewalk cafe shall not be deemed as granting the
licensee exclusive use of the public walk. Any person issued a license to
operate a sidewalk cafe, and all persons so operating a sidewalk cafe, shall
assure, at all times, that a reasonable minimum amount of passable space, in no
event less than four feet (4') in width, is maintained upon the area of the
public sidewalk or way being utilized by the sidewalk cafe, such that persons
not attending the sidewalk cafe may pass freely and easily and without undue
obstruction along and through the area of the public sidewalk being utilized by
the sidewalk cafe. (Ord. 2003-O-44, 7-1-2003)
5-1B-9: SIDEWALK MAINTENANCE REQUIRED:
Any person issued a license to operate, and all persons so operating a sidewalk
cafe, shall assure, at all times, that all areas of the public sidewalk or way
being utilized or adjacent to the business are kept and maintained in good and
proper condition. This shall include, but shall not be limited to, keeping the
area free from all debris, garbage, droppings, deposits, spills, etc. No
damage, alteration, modification, drilling, or change may be made to any part
of any public sidewalk as a result of the issuance of a sidewalk cafe license.
(Ord. 2003-O-44, 7-1-2003)
5-1B-10: ATTENDANT REQUIRED:
Any person issued a license to operate, and all persons so operating a sidewalk
cafe, shall assure that an attendant, waiter or waitress is on duty in and upon
the sidewalk cafe portion of the premises at all times when food or drink is
being consumed at the sidewalk cafe. (Ord. 2003-O-44, 7-1-2003; amd. 2009 Code)
5-1B-11: FOOD AND DRINK CONTROL:
All food and drink shall be stored, displayed and served to avoid attraction of
insects, vermin, rodents and other nuisances, and prompt and efficient cleanup
shall be performed to avoid the same. (Ord. 2003-O-44, 7-1-2003)
5-1B-12: NOISE CONTROL:
Any person issued a license to operate, and all persons so operating a sidewalk
cafe, shall assure, at all times, that operation of the sidewalk cafe does not
cause or result in undue noise which disturbs other residents or the operation
of other businesses in the vicinity. Operation of a sidewalk cafe after ten
o'clock (10:00) P.M. shall be done in such a manner as to especially safeguard
against undue noise, and shall be subject to such further regulations as may be
imposed by the city from time to time. (Ord. 2003-O-44, 7-1-2003)
5-1B-13: EXPANSION AREAS:
Any person owning or operating a business premises for which a sidewalk cafe
license may be issued may request that the city modify the sidewalk area
adjacent to such business premises for sidewalk cafe uses. Such request shall
be forwarded to the city council for review, as it determines appropriate. The
city council, in its sole discretion, may authorize the modification of the
public right of way for an expanded sidewalk cafe area ("expansion area")
subject to the following provisions:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â That in the event the applicant ceases to pay the licensing fee, or the
license for the expansion area is revoked or rescinded by the city, the
applicant be required to cause the restoration of, or pay for the costs of
restoration by the city, of the expansion area to sidewalk, curbing, pavement
and/or landscaping in the city's sole discretion. Further, that prior to the
modification of the right of way to allow the expansion area, the applicant
provide a restoration bond, or a restoration agreement acceptable to the city,
to ensure the provisions of this subsection for restoration may be implemented
by the city.
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â That prior to issuance of the sidewalk cafe license, the applicant
shall provide an acknowledgment, in a form and type acceptable to the city
attorney, that the city shall be permitted to remove the proposed expansion
area in its sole and absolute discretion, as it determines appropriate.
Â Â Â C.Â Â Â That such expansion area as proposed to be constructed is safe for the
proposed patrons, pedestrians, and vehicular traffic in the vicinity. The city
may require the applicant to provide a traffic or engineering study relative to
the proposed expansion area.
Â Â Â D.Â Â Â That the applicant shall be required to pay any and all costs of the
design, construction and installation of the proposed expansion area,
including, but not limited to, engineering costs, design costs, staff costs,
attorney fees or otherwise. An estimate of the proposed costs shall be prepared
prior to the commencement of construction, and such costs shall be paid in full
by the applicant prior to commencement of such construction. (Ord. 2003-O-44,
7-1-2003)
Â Â Â E.Â Â Â That in addition to the license fee required in this article, the
applicant shall pay an additional license fee as provided in section
3-2A-1 of this code for the expansion area. Such licensing fee shall be paid
annually in advance and shall expire on June 30 of each year. Further provided,
that in the event at the time of application, the city council determines that
such expansion area constitutes a permanent benefit to the city, that in lieu
of payment on an annual basis, the applicant shall be given a credit for the
costs paid by the applicant to construct the expansion area. (Ord. 2003-O-44,
7-1-2003; amd. 2009 Code)
Â Â Â F.Â Â Â That upon construction of such a expansion area, the applicant shall be
deemed to have consented to pay the license fees required hereunder on an
annual basis, so long as the business premises continues in operation, or is
otherwise owned, operated or controlled by the applicant, unless the city has
determined that it will remove the proposed expansion area, at which time, the
applicant's financial obligation shall cease.
Â Â Â G.Â Â Â That the proposed expansion area shall complement the public way and/or
proposed or existing streetscape improvements, and shall be otherwise
aesthetically appropriate.
Â Â Â H.Â Â Â That the proposed expansion area shall not unduly impact parking within
the business district. The city shall consider other available parking in the
area, the parking impact of other surrounding establishments and the
applicant's business establishment along with the adequacy of other parking
provided by the applicant for its business establishment.
Â Â Â I.Â Â Â That prior to issuance of the sidewalk cafe license, the applicant
shall provide an indemnification and hold harmless agreement to the city, in a
form and type acceptable to the city attorney.
Â Â Â J.Â Â Â That the applicant shall be solely responsible for the maintenance of
the expansion area. In the event that the applicant fails to maintain the
expansion area and the city opts to provide such maintenance, the costs of such
maintenance provided by the city shall be paid by the applicant. (Ord. 2003-O-
44, 7-1-2003)
5-1B-14: CANCELLATION OR REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
Sidewalk cafe licenses may be canceled and/or revoked by the city at any time.
(Ord. 2006-O-27, 8-15-2006)
5-1B-15: PENALTIES:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â Any person, partnership, firm, corporation, or entity, or employee of
same, violating any provision of this article shall be fined as provided in
section
1-4-1 of this code. (2009 Code)
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â The conviction or punishment of any person, partnership, firm, entity
or corporation for violation of the provisions of this article shall not
release such person from paying any fee due and unpaid at the time of such
conviction, nor shall payment of any fee prevent prosecution for violation of
any of the provisions of this article.
Â Â Â C.Â Â Â The amount of any fee due hereunder shall be deemed a debt to the city.
An action may be commenced in the name of the city in any court of competent
jurisdiction for the amount of any delinquent fee. All unpaid fees shall be
deemed delinquent after they are due and payable.
Â Â Â D.Â Â Â All remedies shall be cumulative, and the use of one or more remedies
by the city shall not bar the use of any other remedy. (Ord. 2003-O-44, 7-1-
2003)
ARTICLE C. CURBSIDE CAFES
SECTION:
5-1C-1: Pilot Program
5-1C-2: Definitions
5-1C-3: Permit Required For Curbside Cafe
5-1C-4: Permit Application And Approval Procedure
5-1C-5: Insurance Required
5-1C-6: Review Of Application
5-1C-7: Compliance With Plan And Other Components Of Application
5-1C-8: Assignment Or Transfer Prohibited
5-1C-9: Restrictions On Issuance Of A Permit
5-1C-10: Operational Conditions
5-1C-11: Alcoholic Beverage Service; Requirements
5-1C-12: Compliance With Code And Regulations Required
5-1C-13: Promulgation Of Regulations; Force And Effect
5-1C-14: Enforcement
